Title: Legal Supervisor
Company: Masan Consumer Holdings

Title: Legal Supervisor
Company: Masan Consumer Holdings
Location: Mplaza Saigon Tower, 39 Le Duan, Ho Chi Minh City, 23 Le Duan Street, District 1, HCMC
Job Description:
JOB SUMMARY
The Legal Supervisor is responsible for providing legal advisory services in the areas of
intellectual property, brand protection, product registration, and advertising. This role ensures
compliance with applicable laws and internal policies, while fostering a culture of compliance
and awareness across the organization.

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES
1. Intellectual Property Management
• Advise and implement legal actions to establish, maintain, and protect intellectual
property rights globally.
• Manage the company’s IP portfolio, including data, systems, and processes.
• Develop and oversee IP management software.
• Prepare periodic and ad-hoc reports on IP matters.
• Conduct training sessions to raise awareness of IP compliance and protection.

2. Product Registration & Advertising Compliance
• Provide legal guidance on product registration and advertising in Vietnam.
• Review and finalize product registration dossiers, labeling, and advertising materials.
• Address customer inquiries related to product registration and advertising compliance.

3. Brand Protection & Dispute Resolution
• Handle reports of counterfeit, infringing, or unauthorized products.
• Collaborate with internal teams and external service providers to propose and execute
legal measures.
• Liaise with government authorities and regulatory agencies to protect the company’s
brand.
• Support customer complaint resolution and provide legal solutions for brand protection.

4. Training & Compliance Culture
• Develop training materials and conduct workshops on IP, product registration, and
advertising compliance.
• Promote compliance awareness and ensure employees understand and adhere to legal
requirements.

5. Other Duties
• Maintain positive relationships with regulatory authorities and monitor legal updates.
• Contribute to the development and improvement of internal legal policies and
procedures.
• Perform other tasks assigned by the Legal Manager and Head of Legal & Compliance.

Title: Senior Production Manager - Packing
Company: Công Ty TNHH LEGO Manufacturing Việt Nam
Location: Số 1 Đường số 3, Khu Công Nghiệp Việt Nam - Singapore III, Phường Bình Cơ
Job Description:
Are you passionate about ensuring smooth operations and maximizing efficiency? Join LEGO Manufacturing Vietnam and play a crucial role in managing and optimizing our state-of-the-art packing production. Lead a talented team, organize the workforce, and drive continuous improvement while contributing to the production of the world's most iconic toys.

Work Location: Our factory is based in VSIP 3, Binh Co Ward, Ho Chi Minh (formerly known as Hoi Nghia Ward, Tan Uyen - Binh Duong). Shuttle buses are provided from Ho Chi Minh, Bien Hoa & Binh Duong

We think it’s important that you’re in control of your data and as part of the recruitment process; Your direct application at the LEGO Careers Website will be prioritized. Please copy and paste the following URL into your browser for your application: https://bit.ly/4aujpCl

Core Responsibilities

• Ultimately responsible for the smooth running of all production lines and the quality of finished goods output. Decision-making and problem-solving form a major part of daily leadership activities.

• Lead both the local team and external labor workforce; collaborate closely with members of other departments (Engineering, Logistics & Warehouse, Quality, Maintenance, Procurement, EHS, etc.). Ensure an efficient and productive manufacturing process that meets customer requirements.

• Ensure daily measurement of operational performance (including reporting and KPI updates).

• Lead continuous improvement initiatives and drive productivity. Manage product changeovers, ramp up new production lines, and achieve the highest labor efficiency.

• Set KPIs for the area and develop the team.

• Direct personnel to achieve maximum performance. Supervise and evaluate the performance of production personnel.

• Determine the right number of resources required (workforce, raw materials, etc.). Organize workflows to meet specifications and deadlines.

• Estimate costs and prepare annual budgets. Control manufacturing costs effectively.

• Enforce health and safety precautions.

• Develop plans for the organization and for individuals within your team.

• Conduct periodic feedback sessions with staff based on formal and informal performance evaluations.

• Follow up on actions in standard processes such as PMP, PRP, and Pulse.

• Actively cooperate with other LEGO sites.

• Serve as a role model for the team and set an example in behavior regarding people’s safety, health, and quality of work.

• Provide support, participate proactively, and demonstrate leadership in QEHS matters in your area.

• Comply with the IMS (Integrated Management System), legal requirements, external/internal standards, and other applicable requirements in your area.

• Actively communicate with subordinates and provide constructive feedback.

Play your part in our team succeeding
This position is designed to lead the team and manage packing production at LEGO Manufacturing Vietnam, with ultimate responsibility for the smooth running of all production lines and the quality of output.

The main challenges include leading operations with high flexibility to manage demand fluctuations, ensuring the team has the right capabilities, and maintaining strict control over budget and wages.

A career in the Actuarial department will provide you an opportunity to be part of a young, dynamic and expanding team, who highly specializes in various areas of the actuarial works such as product development & pricing, capital & risk management, actuarial modelling and distribution initiatives.
We are seeking self-motivated and open-minded individuals, who are brave in the world of risk, to join us in making a difference.

Accountabilities:
1/ VALUATION & REINSURANCE:
• Prepare internal and regulatory reports on key company financials, including but not limited to statutory valuation, capital management, regulatory reporting, insurance capital standard (ICS) and financial conditional report
• Develop actuarial models using Prophet software to ensure that products or new regulations are promptly and accurately modelled
• Conduct in-depth analysis of financial metrics, including persistency and source of profit analysis, with clear explanation of deviations from expectation
• Actively participate in and support various data-oriented projects, such as customer behavior analysis, lapse prediction, using machine learning approach
• Provide support to the management of company’s reinsurance portfolio
2/ RISK & PROJECTS
• Involve in various business support processes, including but not limited to Business Plan, Embedded Value preparation under TEV / ICS basis
• Conduct experience studies, including Expense Study, Claim Study, Lapse Study
• Provide support to Agency & Alternative Distribution Channel regarding compensation scheme, contests, payment, …

Title: Production Planner
Company: CÔNG TY TNHH AJAX SYSTEMS VIỆT NAM
Location: Ajax Systems Factory, Hung Yen, KCN Minh Đức, Hưng Yên, My Hao District, Hung Yen, Vietnam
Job Description:
Employee's Duties
1. Must know:
• organization of production and accounting of the production process;
• production capacity of the enterprise, the nomenclature of products produced, types of performed works (services);
• the procedure for developing production programs and daily shift tasks;
• specialization of departments, sites, and production connections between them;
• resolutions, orders, methodical and regulatory materials on production planning issues at the enterprise;
• the basics of the production technology of the enterprise's products, the basics of economics, labor organization, and management;
• rules and norms of labor protection, safety technology, industrial sanitation, and fire protection.
2. Manages work on operational regulation using computer equipment, communications, and connections of production progress, ensuring rhythmic output of products by the production plan and supply contracts.
3. Manages the development of production plans and calendar schedules of production at the enterprise and its divisions, their adjustment during the planning period, and the development and implementation of standards for production operational planning. Formation of production plans with a planning horizon of a day, a week, or a month.
4. Ensures daily operational accounting of the production process, execution of daily tasks for the release of finished products according to the quantity and nomenclature of products, control over the condition and completeness of work-in-progress, and control of the supply of materials for the production program.
5. Coordinates the work of the enterprise`s divisions, and takes measures to ensure the rhythmic execution of production calendar plans and the prevention and elimination of violations during the production process.
6. Operational re-planning of production based on operational data on supplies.
7. Forecasts the terms of readiness for shipment orders based on the production program and previously accepted orders. Keeps forecast dates in the order database up-to-date for logistics information purposes.
8. Work with the supply department and control ensuring production needs.
9. Assistance in the automation of the operational production planning system.
10. Ensuring activities in accordance with the requirements of the Quality Guidelines.
11. Participating in setting priority goals in the area of quality that can be measured.
12. Conducts work on the identification and development of technical innovations, scientific discoveries and inventions, and best practices that contribute to the improvement of technology, organization of production, and the growth of labor productivity.
13. Application and provision of a process approach for the implementation of production activities in the performance of job duties.
14. Participation in the ongoing analysis of the effectiveness of applied actions in the area of process and product quality.
15. Improves his qualifications by participating in seminars and training.
16. Knows, understands, and applies current regulatory documents related to his activities. Fulfills the requirements of current legislation, decisions, and orders of management.

Mô tả công việc
• Giám sát việc triển khai và theo dõi thực hiện các kế hoạch hành động chi tiết, hoạt động bán hàng nhằm đạt được các mục tiêu tổng thể cho chuỗi khách hàng trọng điểm (doanh thu, chi phí, độ phủ, phân phối, hình ảnh, thị phần...).

• Xây dựng chính sách và chương trình phù hợp để thâm nhập và phát triển sản phẩm Vinamilk tại các điểm bán lẻ.
• Lập kế hoạch và đánh giá hoạt động triển khai/chăm sóc/khai thác của nhân viên hàng tháng đối với danh sách khách hàng mục tiêu (chuỗi khách hàng được chuyển giao, khách hàng tiềm năng, điểm bán có hoặc chưa từng mua sản phẩm công ty...). Xác định và đánh giá cơ hội kinh doanh mới (mở điểm bán mới, tăng SKU/điểm bán, tăng tồn kho...) để khai thác tối đa cơ hội từ khách hàng.
• Giám sát việc thực hiện hợp đồng và quản lý quan hệ khách hàng.

• Duy trì và nâng cao chất lượng dịch vụ, chăm sóc khách hàng tốt nhất, xây dựng mối quan hệ bền chặt với khách hàng và nhà phân phối trong khu vực.
• Chịu trách nhiệm quản lý, giám sát, kiểm soát và đánh giá việc sử dụng nguồn lực liên quan đến bán hàng và khách hàng chuỗi (ngân sách vận hành, nhân sự, tài sản, hoạt động hỗ trợ...) một cách hiệu quả và tuân thủ quy định.

Title: Chief Accountant
Company: Brady Corporation
Location: Bắc Ninh, Việt Nam, Hà Nội, Việt Nam
Job Description:
Job Purpose
• As the Chief Accountant at Brady in Vietnam, your will responsible for overseeing various financial and accounting activities to ensure accurate and compliance financial reporting. You'll work closely with various teams, handle tax compliance, liaise with auditors, oversee contracts, and provide
financial analysis support when necessary.

Reports to: Finance Manager/Assistant Finance Manager

Key Responsibilities
1. Accounting & Financial Reporting:
• Prepare and post manual journal entries and review all accounting entries in SAP.
• Perform a final check before monthly, quarterly, and annual closing to ensure no pending balances.
• Reconcile and compile monthly sales reports (SSM) to ensure they align with SAP sales numbers.
• Prepare monthly general Excess & Obsolete accrual and conduct analysis to minimize inventory exposure.
• Review employee Concur claims to ensure all expenses are reflected in the correct General Ledger (GL) accounts.
• Prepare and submit interim and final Annual Financial Reports (AFR) to the Corporate Tax team.
• Perform account reconciliations between US GAAP and Vietnamese GAAP for tax, audit, and management reporting purposes.
• Manage cash flow to ensure sufficient funds for operations and investments and collaborating with the treasury team and bankers.
2. Tax & Regulatory Compliance:
• Set up and maintain the e-invoice system to ensure full compliance with Vietnam's updated tax laws.
• Prepare and submit quarterly VAT reports to the local authorities.
• Handle all direct and indirect tax compliance requirements.
• Collaborate effectively with tax authorities as needed.
• Prepare and submit Corporate Income Tax (CIT) returns, Transfer Pricing (TP) forms, and other regulatory reports on time.
• Prepare and submit semi-annual and annual Investment Supervision and Assessment Reports (e.g., Form 13 and Form 17).
• Prepare quarterly service fee cross-charges to other SEA regions.
• Prepare loan reports for the Central Bank if the company has intercompany loans.
3. Costing & Financial Analysis:
• Manage the yearly company cost roll and activity rate settings to determine inventory standard costs.
• Conduct customer margin analysis in collaboration with the sales team to enhance company profitability.
• Lead the annual budgeting activity, including cost center and COGS budgets.
• Perform monthly financial result analysis, manufacturing variance analysis, comparing actuals against budget.
4. Hr & Administration:
• Maintain employee personnel files (P-files) to ensure accuracy and compliance.
• Support the monthly payroll process, including SAP entry and coordination.
• Assist with the documentation and recording-keeping for employee Personal Income Tax (PIT).
• Contribute to payroll auditing activities in local context.
• Maintain and Organize all HR documentation and records in local context.
• Coordinate employee insurance records and associated documentation.
• Providing assistance with document translation as required.

Title: QC / SQE Assistant Manager
Company: Moose Toys Vietnam
Location: 5th Floor, No 1, Lot 3C, Le Hong Phong Street, Dong Khe Ward, Ngo Quyen District, Hai Phong, Floor 6, Khanh Nguyen Building, 87A Ham Nghi St., Saigon Ward, Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam
Job Description:
The QC / SQE Assistant Manager is responsible for ensuring suppliers meet Moose’s quality, reliability and compliance standards, including building systems, processes, check points and line equipment that prevent defects and drive continuous improvement for production.

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES

Process Control, Workflow Evaluation and Manufacturing Oversight
• Establish checkpoints in production lines with suppliers and monitor critical process.
• Validate supplier process controls
• Ensure supplier follow standardized manufacturing process according to Moose’s critical specification.
• Evaluate efficiency and risk of supplier’s workflows.
• Apply six sigma and lean methodologies to optimize operations
• Drive Corrective and preventive active for recurring issues.

Problem solving, Root Cause and Data Analysis
• Lead supplier to perform investigation and failure analysis
• Define root cause with supplier and design short term fix to secure shipment
• Plan with supplier for long term corrective action
• Monitor supplier performance and support KPI study
• Provide detailed analysis to manager and report quality trends.
• Utilize statistical tools and power BI to present data to manager.

Defect reduction, cost savings and cross function collaboration
• Drive initiatives to lower defect rate, avoid scrap and rework costs
• Optimize check points, inline testing and quality check manpower.
• Work closely with procurement, engineering and planning team to align company objectives.

Support adoption of AI technologies at supplier sites
• Increase automation across production lines to enhance efficiency
• Drive to implement camera-based or robotic inspection systems to minimize human error
• Reduce reliance on manual inspections by advanced automated solutions.

Title: Specialist, Super User Procurement (Procure-to-pay)
Company: Công Ty TNHH Pandora Production Việt Nam
Location: VSIP III, Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam - Singapore Industrial Park III, Hoi Nghia Ward, Tan Uyen, Binh Duong
Job Description:
About Pandora
Pandora is the world's largest jewellery brand, specialising in the design, crafting and marketing of accessible luxury jewellery made from high-quality materials. Each piece is created to inspire self-expression, allowing people to share their stories and passions through meaningful jewellery. Pandora jewellery is sold in more than 100 countries through 6,800 points of sale, including more than 2,700 concept stores.

Headquartered in Copenhagen, Denmark, Pandora employs 37,000 people worldwide and crafts its jewellery using only recycled silver and gold. Pandora is committed to leadership in sustainability and has set out to halve greenhouse gas emissions across its value chain by 2030. Pandora is listed on the Nasdaq Copenhagen stock exchange and generated revenue of DKK 31.7 billion (EUR 4.2 billion) in 2024.

About Pandora Vietnam
Pandora’s new jewellery crafting facility is located in the Vietnam–Singapore Industrial Park III (VSIP III), about 40 km north of Ho Chi Minh City. When fully scaled, the state-of-the-art facility will produce up to 60 million jewellery pieces annually and employ around 7,000 craftspeople. It is powered entirely by renewable energy and built to LEED Gold certification standards.

------------------------------

Key accountabilities
• Understand business processes to drive process and technology improvements. Partner with stakeholders and programme teams to design, test, train, and continuously enhance solutions in Vietnam, acting as a bridge between end-users and Digital & Technology post-implementation.
• Support strategic and tactical decisions for the Indirect category in alignment with Supply Chain plans and company strategy.
• Oversee the end-to-end procurement of goods and services, ensuring governance compliance, stakeholder collaboration, and continuous process improvement.

Key duties
1. Act as Procurement system champion, supporting SAP & Basware implementation through testing, training, change management, go‑live readiness, and ongoing end‑user support:
• Understand end‑to‑end business workflows (PR → PO → GR → Invoice → Payment) and ensure system configuration aligns with business needs.
• Perform functional testing, identify system defects, log issues, and support troubleshooting with the project team
• Deliver training sessions, act as first line support to guide users on new system changes, workflows, and best practices
• Gather user feedback, concerns, and enhancement needs; escalate to project team as needed and ensure issues are fixed.
• Identify system optimization opportunities and enhancements after deployment.Others if needed to support for Project.

2. Sourcing & Supplier Management:
• Perform sourcing & negotiation for Ad-hoc requisition follow our Procurement governance policies with cost effectiveness.
• Collaboratively work with suppliers and partners, Support category strategies, tactic, process, spend, supplier performance and relationship under Indirect category.
• Collaborate effectively with relevant parties to ensure high adherences to standards of indirect materials and other
• Create supplier assessment and collaborate effectively with all relevant stakeholders to ensure stringent standards
• Create operational standardized data analytics including spend analysis to manage category strategy
• Perform sourcing & negotiation for Ad-hoc requisition.
• Lead supplier negotiation in term of commercial term & technical term (if need) to ensure the Pandora’s requirement is.
• Minimize conflict of interest through challenging status quo, ensure engagement and alignment on strategy and tactical from key stakeholders including decision.
• Negotiate and create draft contract based on master contract template and consult with Legal in case of deviation from master template – Legal supports Procurement team.
• Create and maintain supplier master data and participate in relevant governance forum as needed.
• Support supplier relationships and performance.
• Execute an effective risk mitigation (for example multi-source, supply chain mapping and etc.) to safeguard against disruptions.
• Support Carbon emission team and drive suppliers on carbon emission engagement program to deliver company target commitment.

3. Procure to Pay:
• Complete purchasing activities for indirect category.
• Track day-to-day performance and order status of indirect category.
• Sourcing for vendor and management of supplies to provide service at lowest total cost
• Monitor supplier/service provider performance by keep tracking of supplier quality and support end-user to follow up delivery for smooth operations.
• Provide inputs regarding local practice and limitation; ensure contract comply to local regulations.
• Execute indirect materials and other supplier day-to-day operations including status tracking and short-term SLA tracking
• Monitor local supplier /service provider data, analyze performance, performance regulator audit of performance and driver performance improvement.
• Ensure local supplier qualification and compliance of legal, ethical and partner commitments
• Support local procurement improvement initiatives
• Responsible for accurate and timely business performance reporting of Lamphun site

4. Stakeholder management:
• Collaborate effectively with internal stakeholders to define and manage risk of project and also ensure high adherences to standard of procurement.
• Support supplier assessment and collaborate effectively with all relevant stakeholders to ensure stringent standards.

5. Other assignments (if any) from Manager.

Job Description:
The Senior Compliance Accountant provides efficient and effective assistance to the Melbourne Head Office Finance Department, including reporting, audits, and tax compliance.

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES

Tax & Statutory Compliance
• Ensure compliance with all statutory obligations across allocated divisions
• Manage the tax calculations, compliance, tax affairs and tax returns of allocated entities
• Support the preparation of FBT, R&D, WHT, Transfer Pricing documentation
• Lead the external audit process to a successful outcome.
• Manage the preparation of annual reports for allocated entities and the global consolidated reports
• Manage licensing audits to successful outcome
• Review licensing contracts as required

• Risk management (credit, internal controls, payment approvals, banking admin & signing authority, JDE user system access)

Projects
• Assist Global Compliance Manager with allocated project work
• Prepare and maintain detailed procedures for all key processes managed

Employee Responsibilities
Take reasonable care for your health and safety and of persons who may be affected by your acts or omissions. Title: Project Executive – Ecommerce (Social Commerce & Livestream)
Company: DKSH Vietnam Co., Ltd.
Location: Viettel Tower, 285 Cách Mạng Tháng Tám, Phường 12 (Quận 10), Quận 10, Thành phố Hồ Chí Minh, Việt Nam, 5th Floor, Viettel Complex Tower, 285 Cach Mang Thang Tam Street, Ward 12, District 10, Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam
Job Description:
1. Job Summary
The Project Manager – Ecommerce is responsible for leading and coordinating key initiatives in social commerce, affiliate growth, partnership development, and livestream operations. This role plays a pivotal part in expanding online sales revenue through effective project execution, partner ecosystem development, and high-quality livestream operations. The ideal candidate must be highly organized, data-driven, proactive, and able to collaborate across cross-functional teams.
2. Key Responsibilities
A. Social Commerce & Affiliate Growth
• Identify, connect and build long-term partnerships with TAP partners, MCNs, KOL networks, creators, and affiliate communities to drive incremental ecommerce revenue.
• Develop and manage the affiliate performance dashboard; evaluate ROI by partner, product category, and campaign.
• Coordinate with internal teams (content, KAMs, performance marketing) to ensure smooth execution of affiliate & social commerce campaigns.
• Explore new social commerce formats (short-form video selling, community commerce, creator-led launches…) to capture emerging opportunities.
B. Business Development Support
• Support BD activities including but not limited to market opportunity exploration, competitive landscape research, potential segment evaluation, and new sales channel identification.
• Conduct feasibility studies for new initiatives and prepare project proposals, financial assessments, and go-to-market recommendations.
• Work with cross-functional teams to manage partner onboarding, contract coordination, and execution of new business pilot programs.
C. Livestream Operations Management
• Lead end-to-end livestream planning: monthly content calendar, campaign alignment, thematic development, host assignment, and coordination with technical teams.
• Monitor livestream performance, analyze KPIs (viewership, engagement, conversion, revenue) and propose continuous improvement plans.
• Recruit, assess, and manage livestream hosts:
o Host selection & evaluation
o Training on product knowledge, livestream techniques, brand tone
o Performance feedback and skill development
• Ensure all livestream sessions comply with platform rules, brand guidelines, and ecommerce KPIs.
D. Project Execution & Cross-Functional Collaboration
• Act as the central coordinator for social commerce and livestream-related projects.
• Ensure all timelines, deliverables, and milestones are met.
• Coordinate with Operations, KAM, Creative, Performance Marketing, CS, and external partners to guarantee smooth execution.
• Provide regular reporting for management review, including insights, risks, actions, and recommendations.

Title: Trưởng Phòng Vận Hành Mạng Lưới Trạm Đổi Pin
Company: Công Ty Cổ Phần Phương Tiện Điện Thông Minh Selex
Location: Số 12, ngõ 36 Xuân Thuỷ, Dịch Vọng Hậu, Cầu Giấy, Hà Nội, 26 Đường Phan Thúc Duyện, Phường 4, Tân Bình, Hồ Chí Minh, Việt Nam, 11a/36 Xuân Thủy, Dịch Vọng Hậu, Cầu Giấy, Hà Nội, Việt Nam
Job Description:
1. Mô tả công việc
- Chịu trách nhiệm tổng thể về độ ổn định, an toàn và khả năng đáp ứng của toàn bộ mạng lưới trạm đổi pin Selex
- Xây dựng chiến lược, kế hoạch vận hành trung – dài hạn cho mạng lưới trạm; thiết lập KPI, theo dõi và chịu trách nhiệm kết quả thực hiện
- Xây dựng, chuẩn hóa và triển khai đồng bộ hệ thống quy trình, tiêu chuẩn, quy định vận hành trạm đổi pin trên toàn mạng lưới
- Tổ chức giám sát, đánh giá chất lượng hoạt động của trạm đổi pin (uptime, độ sẵn sàng, an toàn, trải nghiệm người dùng); kịp thời phát hiện và xử lý các vấn đề phát sinh
- Tổng hợp, phân tích dữ liệu vận hành mạng lưới; đề xuất cải tiến quy trình, mô hình vận hành và các giải pháp nâng cao hiệu suất, độ ổn định hệ thống
- Chỉ đạo, điều phối công tác xử lý sự cố, bảo trì, sửa chữa, thay thế thiết bị trạm đổi pin; đảm bảo thời gian khắc phục nhanh, hạn chế gián đoạn dịch vụ
- Phụ trách kế hoạch mở mới điểm đổi pin: khảo sát, đề xuất vị trí, phối hợp triển khai, nghiệm thu và đưa trạm vào vận hành
- Quản lý nguồn lực phục vụ vận hành mạng lưới (nhân sự, vật tư, phụ tùng, nhà thầu); đảm bảo sử dụng hiệu quả và tối ưu chi phí vận hành
- Xây dựng và phát triển đội ngũ vận hành trạm: tuyển dụng, đào tạo, phân công, đánh giá hiệu quả; đảm bảo an toàn lao động, kỷ luật vận hành và văn hóa công ty
- Báo cáo trực tiếp và thực hiện các nhiệm vụ khác từ Tổng Giám đốc.

2. Quyền lợi
- Thu nhập cạnh tranh từ 40-55 triệu/tháng, có thể cao hơn theo năng lực
- Thưởng theo quy định công ty và thưởng hiệu suất gắn với KPI vận hành mạng lưới
- Giữ vai trò trọng tâm trong hệ sinh thái xe máy điện Selex, trực tiếp sở hữu và dẫn dắt toàn bộ hoạt động vận hành mạng lưới trạm đổi pin
- Cơ hội tham gia xây dựng và mở rộng mô hình hạ tầng đổi pin tiên phong tại Việt Nam, tạo tác động lớn đến thị trường giao thông xanh
- Là đầu mối làm việc với các đối tác chiến lược lớn của công ty như Petrolimex và các đối tác hạ tầng, bán lẻ, năng lượng hàng đầu
- Môi trường startup công nghệ tăng trưởng nhanh, trao quyền mạnh, được chủ động thiết kế mô hình vận hành và đội ngũ
- Cơ hội phát triển lên các vị trí quản lý cấp cao hơn trong mảng vận hành/hạ tầng khi mạng lưới mở rộng toàn quốc
- Thưởng theo quy định công ty và thưởng hiệu suất gắn trực tiếp với KPI vận hành mạng lưới
- Được tiếp cận công nghệ, dữ liệu vận hành quy mô lớn và làm việc với đội ngũ kỹ thuật – sản phẩm hàng đầu trong lĩnh vực xe điện
- Môi trường làm việc trẻ năng động, chuyên nghiệp; chế độ BHXH theo quy định.

4. Phối hợp với QA/QC, Kho, Chuỗi cung ứng và Kinh doanh để đảm bảo chất lượng sản phẩm, chứng từ hợp lệ và tiến độ cung ứng.
5. Giám sát và đảm bảo tuân thủ hợp đồng, xử lý các vấn đề phát sinh liên quan đến chất lượng – giao hàng – pháp lý.
6. Theo dõi thị trường, phân tích giá và đánh giá rủi ro, đề xuất giải pháp tối ưu chi phí và đảm bảo ổn định nguồn cung.
7. Thực hiện báo cáo định kỳ về tình hình mua hàng, chi phí, biến động thị trường và hiệu quả tiết kiệm.

Title: Specialist, Production (ISO Certification)
Company: Công Ty TNHH Pandora Production Việt Nam
Location: Số 6 Đường số 3, Khu công nghiệp Việt Nam - Singapore III, Thành phố Hồ Chí Minh, Việt Nam, Vietnam - Singapore Industrial Park III, Hoi Nghia Ward, Tan Uyen, Binh Duong
Job Description:
About Pandora
Pandora is the world's largest jewellery brand, specialising in the design, crafting and marketing of accessible luxury jewellery made from high-quality materials. Each piece is created to inspire self-expression, allowing people to share their stories and passions through meaningful jewellery. Pandora jewellery is sold in more than 100 countries through 6,800 points of sale, including more than 2,700 concept stores.

Headquartered in Copenhagen, Denmark, Pandora employs 37,000 people worldwide and crafts its jewellery using only recycled silver and gold. Pandora is committed to leadership in sustainability and has set out to halve greenhouse gas emissions across its value chain by 2030. Pandora is listed on the Nasdaq Copenhagen stock exchange and generated revenue of DKK 31.7 billion (EUR 4.2 billion) in 2024.

About Pandora Vietnam
Pandora’s new jewellery crafting facility is located in the Vietnam–Singapore Industrial Park III (VSIP III), about 40 km north of Ho Chi Minh City. When fully scaled, the state-of-the-art facility will produce up to 60 million jewellery pieces annually and employ around 7,000 craftspeople. It is powered entirely by renewable energy and built to LEED Gold certification standards.

------------------------------

Key accountabilities
The role is responsible for driving production performance through KPI execution, process control, and continuous improvement to ensure on-time delivery, required quality, and optimal cost. The role also manages ISO/ISP systems and social compliance requirements within Production, ensuring audit readiness, documentation control, training, and effective CAPA to meet ISO standards, regulatory requirements, and customer expectations.

Key duties
1. ISO Management System/ Compliance (Production):
• ISO Management System & Social Compliance (Disney): Manage and improve ISO management systems for production, ensure process and documentation compliance, maintain ISO related documents, support internal social compliance audits, and prepare documentation for third party assessments.
• Audit & Compliance: Plan and conduct internal ISO and production audits, coordinate external audits, prepare audit plans and reports, and follow up on non conformities and CAPA closure.
• Training & Awareness: Develop and manage ISO training materials, deliver training on standards and compliance requirements, and promote awareness of quality, safety, and continuous improvement.
• Continuous Improvement: Analyze data and audit results to identify improvement opportunities, support corrective actions and process optimization, and participate in risk assessments and root cause analysis.
• Cross functional Coordination: Collaborate with Production, Quality, HSE, Engineering, and Supply Chain teams, support ISO management reviews, and act as the primary ISO contact point for production.

2. Production Operation:
• Drive area and cross-functional KPIs to ensure products and projects are delivered on time, at the highest quality, and optimal cost.
• Execute production plans in compliance with approved procedures and Work Instructions (WIs) within the Pandora system; develop SOPs, WIs, and process documentation as required.
• Proactively contribute ideas, recommend solutions, and support continuous improvement initiatives.

Title: Area Security Manager (VN & TH)
Company: UPS Vietnam
Location: 18A Đường Cộng Hòa, Phường Bảy Hiền, TP. HCM, Việt Nam, 18A Cong Hoa, Ward 12, Tan Binh District, Hồ Chí Minh, Việt Nam
Job Description:
Develops and Implements Country/Area Strategic Plans
• Analyzes claim expenses to ensure the district meets business plan targets.
• Attends district security planning meetings to provide input into the development of region security plans.
• Coordinates lead country Crisis Response Team, room set-up and periodic drills to prepare for emergency situations.
• Develops district business plan, staffing and initiatives to align with regional goals and objectives.
• Implements consistent performance indices to measure progress on corrective action plans for losses and damages.

Oversees Country/Area Security Operations
• Directs government and internal UPS aviation security and gateway-related audits to ensure compliance with government regulations and internal UPS processes.
• Directs security audits of physical assets (e.g., buildings, vehicles, etc.) to ensure compliance with company processes and procedures.
• Monitors service failure reports to identify procedural breakdowns and employee dishonesty incidents.
• Reviews entrance and exit procedures for company facilities to ensure security guards follow the rules and regulations for each facility.
• Reviews physical security technology requirements, plans, and costs to initiate installation of new or replacement equipment as needed.

Directs Security Investigations
• Distributes investigation findings to management and government agencies to ensure an appropriate response to the incident.
• Evaluates investigative techniques used by security personnel to ensure company guidelines are followed.
• Gathers information (e.g., research, interviews, surveillance, etc.) to prepare accurate and thorough case files.
• Reviews incident reporting results (e.g., investigations, terminations, etc.) to determine their impact on the company’s business results.

Maintain External Relationships with In-Country Agencies
• Collaborates with government agencies (e.g., CAA, etc.) to comply with international regulations.
• Participates in internal cross-functional and customer meetings to remain current with customer and UPS strategic objectives while promoting and ensuring security.
• Participates in security-related organizations to stay current with loss prevention processes, trends, and technologies.
• Partners with international and local law enforcement agencies to prevent and disrupt illegal activities (e.g., contraband, etc.).

Manages and Develops Others
• Coaches others and provides on-going feedback and support to improve performance.
• Conducts frequent performance evaluations in a consistent, fair, and objective manner to facilitate open communication and encourage continuous performance improvement.
• Ensures that direct and indirect reports have documented career goals and detailed plans for achieving these goals to develop them personally and professionally.
• Holds others accountable to established performance levels to achieve individual and group goals.
• Identifies individual and team skill gaps and developmental opportunities (e.g., training, special assignments, conferences, projects, etc.) to facilitate individual and team development.
• Identifies opportunities to involve others in new and challenging work assignments and/or rotations that advance the skills and capabilities of individuals and the organization.
• Make salary recommendations to reward employee performance.
• Manages resources and people processes (e.g., Performance Management, Career Development, Training, Staffing, etc.) to ensure the day-to-day administration of processes and formal procedures.
• Resolves individual and group performance issues in accordance with UPS’s policies and procedures in a timely manner to motivate and foster teamwork.

Title: [Urgent] Service Engineer
Company: Melchers Vietnam Co., Ltd
Location: Lot CN14, My Thuan Industrial Zone, My Loc Ward, Ninh Binh Province, 4th Fl., 58 Dong Khoi Street, District 1, HCMC
Job Description:
On-site service engineer
One of our Melchers’ partners develops, manufactures, and sells high-quality inspection systems. Their product portfolio encompasses the complete bandwidth of optical and X-ray inspection operations, especially in the area of electronics assemblies. Their systems are used whenever 100% automatic inspection of electronics assemblies is required, such as in the production of automotive electronics, aerospace technology and industrial electronics, as well as in entertainment and telecommunications electronics. The objective is a flawless product for the customer and efficient process control. They are one of the world's leading suppliers in this segment.
1. OBJECTIVE
The service engineer is responsible for the on-site support at different contracted manufacturer sites, including: trouble shooting in case of machine break-down, preventive machine maintenance, creation and release new overlays and the implementation of customer requirements to ensure that the customers’ satisfaction goals are met.
2. RESPONSIBILITIES
The on-site service engineer is expected to:
- Providing shift support at different contracted manufacturer sites, including day and night shift
- Participation at the Service-Hotline including on call duty during the night shift
- Execution of the preventive maintenance for manual and automated X-Ray equipment
- Trouble shooting in case of machine break down for manual and automated X-Ray equipment.
- Creation of inspection programs for manual and automated X-Ray equipment
- Traveling to support teams at other locations if necessary.
- All duties need to be executed in Chinese and English language if required. Extensive travel may be required.

- Tham gia chuẩn bị hồ sơ pháp lý phục vụ kiểm tra, thanh tra, làm việc với các bên liên quan.
e) Quản lý hồ sơ & báo cáo
- Quản lý, lưu trữ hồ sơ pháp lý dự án, hợp đồng theo quy định của Công ty.

- Thực hiện các công việc khác theo phân công.

- Báo cáo và phân tích tài chính:

- Phân tích tiền khả thi cho các dự án mới:
+ Thu thập và phân tích thông tin về các dự án mới, lĩnh vực kinh doanh mới để hỗ trợ Ban Giám đốc trong việc ra quyết định đầu tư.

+ Đưa ra các báo cáo và khuyến nghị dựa trên nghiên cứu thị trường và phân tích dữ liệu.

- Nhiệm vụ khác theo chỉ đạo của Ban Giám đốc, như:
+ Tham gia kiểm soát chi phí, trực tiếp làm việc với đối tác trong giai đoạn xây dựng và lắp đặt nhà máy mới để đảm bảo nghĩa vụ của các bên hay tiến độ, chất lượng công việc.
+ Tham gia vào các hoạt động kiểm soát tài chính, kiểm soát tuân thủ, vận hành hay quản trị rủi ro theo dự án.

- Thu nhập thỏa thuận theo năng lực.
- Chế độ nghỉ phép năm, nghỉ mát, teambuilding, bảo hiểm xã hội và bảo hiểm y tế theo quy định của pháp luật.

- Làm việc trực tiếp với Chủ tịch/ Phó Chủ tịch, nhiều cơ hội phát triển thành Quản lý Tài chính của các đơn vị/ Công ty trong hệ thống Tập đoàn.

Title: Student Affairs Manager
Company: Công Ty TNHH Giáo Dục Và Đào Tạo Vinacademy
Job Description:
ABOUT VINUNIVERSITY
VinUniversity (VinUni: https://vinuni.edu.vn/) is the first private, not-for-profit Vietnamese university established based on international standards. The university integrates the models of excellent international universities with the unique cultural and economic characteristics of Vietnam, to make a breakthrough in Vietnamese higher education and to become a world-class university.

The University has built strategic collaborations with Cornell University and the University of Pennsylvania — a choice that speaks to our commitment to excellence, innovation in research and teaching, and to making a difference in the world.

VinUni comprises of College of Arts and Sciences; College of Business and Management; College of Engineering and Computer Science; and College of Health Sciences.

Every aspect of the University: its curricula, research, faculty, student body, facilities, and campus life, is being developed to meet the highest standards set by the world’s leading accrediting and ranking organizations, such as ABET, AACSB, WFME, ACEN, Quacquarelli Symonds (QS) and Times Higher Education (THE).

VinUni’s founding benefactor – Vingroup is one of the biggest private conglomerates in Asia with the largest market capitalization value in Vietnam. As a multisector corporation, Vingroup focuses on three main areas: Industrials & Technology; Real Estate & Services; Social Enterprises. VinUni is proud to be a part of the Vingroup ecosystem, giving its students opportunities to connect with pioneering companies (such as VinFast, Vinpearl, Vinmec, Vinschool, and Vinhomes) and an dynamic entrepreneurial ecosystem (such as VinVenture, VinMotion, and VinRobotics…).

In September 2024, VinUni became the youngest and fastest university in the world to achieve QS 5 stars, earning 5 stars in 9 categories: global engagement, good governance, program strength, academic development, teaching, employability, facilities, arts, and social impact. In October 2024, VinUni was appointed by UNESCO as the first and only UNESCO University Chair, focusing on Environmental Leadership, Cultural Heritage, and Biodiversity.

THE OPPORTUNITY
The Student Affairs Manager will report to the Vice Provost for Academic Administration, lead the Student Affairs function under the Center for Student Experience and Services, providing a comprehensive one-stop service that supports all student populations. This role will oversee key areas, including Student Life Activities, the Student Personal Support Office, and Student Academic Support Services. The position is central to fostering student retention and ensuring positive student satisfaction outcomes throughout the student lifecycle.

POSITION RESPONSIBILITES
Student affairs and wellbeing:
- Oversee all aspects of student residential life, including dormitories, housing operations, and the Faculty-in-Residence program.
- Manage the operation and scheduling of the sports complex and recreation facilities.
- Foster a vibrant and inclusive campus living experience through residential engagement programming.
- Design and implement mental health initiatives, counseling services, and peer-support programs.
- Provide crisis intervention and wellbeing workshops.
- Partner with academic and administrative units to promote holistic student wellness
Student-led Activities and Events; Student Council, Clubs, and Societies:
- Support and advise student-led organizations in event planning, logistics, and budgeting.
- Ensure compliance with university policies and promote leadership development through extracurricular activities.
- Serve as the primary liaison for Student Council and officially recognized student clubs.
- Provide training, leadership development, and operational support.
- Facilitate fair and transparent club funding and recognition processes.
Work Study Program:
- Manage the student work-study program, including recruitment, placement, and payroll coordination.
- Develop guidelines, monitor performance, and ensure meaningful learning experiences.
Student Awarding and Disciplinary:
- Administer non-academic awards and recognition for student contributions and achievements
- Coordinate student disciplinary processes in accordance with university regulations.
Diversity, Inclusion, and Belonging Initiatives:
- Design and lead programs that promote diversity, inclusion, and a sense of belonging among students.
- Collaborate with academic and administrative partners to build an inclusive campus climate
Student Services & Experience:
- Operate both virtual and physical student service counters to address inquiries, feedback, and issues.
- Manage operations of the campus merchandise store (online and offline).
- International Student Experience: Provide onboarding, orientation, and ongoing support for international students; Coordinate visa services, cultural exchange activities, and advocacy efforts to enhance international student success.
- Monitoring Student Digital Platforms: Oversee content, usability, and responsiveness of student-facing digital platforms (e.g., MyVinUni mobile app, student portal, website). Monitor feedback and analytics to drive continuous improvement.
Student Success Management:
- First-Year Experience (OASIS): Coordinate and deliver orientation and transition programs through OASIS to support first-year student success; Collaborate with academic and co-curricular partners to create a strong foundation for new students.
- Co-curricular Transcript: Manage the co-curricular transcript platform to document and validate students’ out-of-classroom learning; Promote student engagement across activities that align with institutional learning outcomes.
- Coordinate the Peer Assisted Study Sessions (PASS) program
- Implement advising frameworks, early alert systems, and targeted interventions to support student retention and progression
- Track and support students‘ Individual Development Plans (IDP) across academic years.

Title: Greater Asia Business Unit Product Sourcing Strategy Head
Company: Unilever Vietnam
Location: Unilever’s homebase, Hochiminh city, 156 Nguyen Luong Bang, Tan Phu Ward, Dist.7
Job Description:
JOB PURPOSE
Driving innovation deployment and strategic capacity planning across the Business Unit markets in Greater Asia, ensuring alignment with Business Group (BG) guardrails and integrated customer operations. The role balances innovation execution, technology enablement, and long-term planning to secure sustainable growth.

WHAT WILL YOUR MAIN RESPONSIBILITIES BE
1. Innovation Deployment
• Lead the timely roll-out of new innovations within the BU, ensuring compliance with BG guardrails and strategic priorities.
• Collaborate with cross-functional teams (Supply Chain, Marketing, R&D) to deliver innovations on time and in full (QOTIF).
• Define optimum sourcing networks to meet cost and timing targets for innovation launches.
• Collaborate with procurement to develop key RPM supplier to serve innovations, in terms of capability and capacity.
• Develop first production and transition plans, ensuring capacity readiness and stock build targets at sourcing sites.
• Monitor post-launch performance and resolve supply or quality issues within the first 3 months of deployment.

2. Strategic Capacity Planning
• Own the long-term capacity planning process (+24 months horizon) for Finished Goods across sourcing units.

Title: Talent Acquisition Specialist – Mass Recruitment
Company: Avery Dennison Vietnam
Location: Long Hau Industrial Park, Can Giuoc District, Long An province, Lot E.01, Trung Tam Road, Long Hau IP, Nha Be
Job Description:
ABOUT THE ROLE
The Talent Acquisition Specialist – Mass Recruitment is responsible for managing end-to-end high-volume recruitment of blue-collar workforce for manufacturing operations.
With at least 3 years of hands-on experience, this role plays a key part in ensuring timely manpower fulfillment by proactively sourcing, screening, issuing offers, and closely following up onboarding. The position requires strong execution, high attention to detail, resilience under pressure, and effective communication with hiring managers in a fast-paced factory environment.

YOUR RESPONSIBILITIES WILL INCLUDE
1. Hiring Manager & Stakeholder Partnership
• Act as a trusted recruitment partner to hiring managers and production leaders.
• Translate manpower plans into actionable recruitment activities with clear timelines.
• Provide regular updates, market insights, and realistic hiring solutions based on labor availability.

2. Mass Sourcing & Assessment
• Independently manage high-volume recruitment for direct labor positions (machine operators, warehouse operators, QC operators etc.).
• Develop and execute sourcing strategies through local labor markets, referrals, manpower agencies, job boards, social media, walk-in recruitment, and community channels.
• Maintain a continuous labor pipeline to support urgent and large-scale hiring needs.
• Conduct initial screening to assess work experience, shift flexibility, physical requirements, and job fit.
• Coordinate interviews, and selection processes with line managers.
• Ensure a smooth and efficient candidate experience throughout the recruitment process.

3. Offer Letter & Onboarding Management
• Prepare and issue offer letters and employment documents in line with company policy and basic labor law requirements.
• Proactively follow up with candidates on offer acceptance, document submission, medical check, and onboarding schedules.
• Closely track reporting status to minimize no-show, late withdrawal, and onboarding drop-off.

4. HR Operations & Reporting
• Maintain accurate recruitment trackers, candidate files, and onboarding records.
• Prepare periodic recruitment reports on hiring progress, fulfillment rate, and key challenges.
• Ensure compliance with internal procedures and audit requirements.

5. Others tasks assigned by manager
